project.name: |---- 010-journal-fonts
project.description:
This project is based on 004-journal and explores font capabilities of HTML and CSS.
font-family: + sans-serif - fonts without serif, more readable than serif on computer screens - Examples: Verdana, Arial, Geneva, ... + serif - fonts with serifs (decorative barbs), typically associated with the look of newspapers print. - Examples: Times, Times New Roman, Georgia + monospace - fonts with constant width characters - Examples: Courier, Courier New, Consolas, ... + cursive - fonts that look handwritten - Examples: Comic Sans, Apple Chancery, ... + fantasy - stylized, decorative fonts - Examples: Impact
typically, you specify the font-family property and a list of fonts, that should conclude with the specification of a family: font-family : Verdana, Geneva, Arial, sans-serif;
font-size: can be specified in px, or in pct to a font-size inherited from the parent element. You can also specify a scaling factor units (em) which is similar to pct. You can also specify sizes with keywords such as x-small, large, xx-large, etc. Recommended pattern: + Choose a keyword for the font-size of the body rule. + Specify the font sizes of the other elements relative to the body font-size using either em or pct.
font-weight: bold, etc. font-style: italic, oblique, ... color: by name, by rgb pcts as in rgb(80%, 40%, 0%); or rgb(255, 25, 0) or in hex #ff1000 { the formula to map pcts in values is y = (x * 255) / 100 } Note that there is a shorthand if each two digit pair shares the same numbers as in #cb0 for #ccbb00, or #1ea for #11eeaa... text-decoration: underline, overline, none, etc.
Web Fonts : allows you to deliver a font as part of the payload of your page, so that the client will receive the font when it is not installed in the system. This is done with a special css rule @font-face.
The project consist in structuring a journal web page that includes a title, a description and a sequence of three entries of the journal, all of them sharing the same structure: date, an optional image and some text.
journal.html : The main page for the Journal.
